topic.title: KopyKate - YouTube alternative for ZeroNet [UPDATE 1.3.24]
topic.body:
## view on ZeroNet!
http://127.0.0.1:43110/kopykate.bit
 
## Change Log:
## v1.3.24
> - Improved player CSS.
> - Changed admin e-mail.
> - Added option to either upload instant webseed or upload torrent.
> - (NEW - Katy-Torrent WebTorrent client under development. See below!)
 
## Introduction:
KopyKate is a ZeroNet site; it is an alternative to YouTube, but instead of hosting videos on webservers, it uses decentralized databases in order to store magnet links for videos, and then uses WebTorrent in order to stream them. Note that WebTorrent (WebRTC) and BitTorrent use two different protocols, and the videos can only be seeded by clients made specifically for WebTorrent (e.g. WebTorrent Desktop). Users also have the option to upload webseeds to a CORS-enabled webserver. This allows torrents to temporarily use a backup file from an HTTP server, until enough peers are available!
 
## view on GitHub!
https://github.com/kopy-kate/kopy-kate
## NEW - KatyTorrent WebTorrent client
https://github.com/kopy-kate/katy-torrent
 
## Use these links to view outside of ZeroNet!
http://www.kittyseedbox.tk:43110/kopykate.bit
https://fuckcf.cf/kopykate.bit
 
## If you want to get your video featured (USD $5 a month via Bitcoin)
Contact on ZeroNet: @ realkittykate
Contact on e-mail: kopykate@protonmail.com

topic.title: Politics is a waste of energy
topic.body: Ultimately, your best chances of bringing about actual [change] is to live free, break laws that create victimless crimes whenever necessary, weasel your way out of criminal convictions by studying the law or getting a good lawyer, etc. .. while at the same time being a compassionate and caring human being who treats others with respect and also giving to charity and those in need whenever you can.

topic.title: How would a Zeronet proxy deal with really, big files?
topic.body: Considering how many of them have limited storage.. does it have to fully download every single file that is viewed by the client?

topic.title: Duniter - Cryptocurrency meets Basic Income
topic.body:
http://basicincome.org/news/2017/01/interview-time-digital-basic-income/
https://duniter.org/en/introduction/

We live in disastrous times right now.. but it neededn't all be doom and gloom. 

I'd like to imagine a world in which the biggest concern of the poorest kid in Africa.. is getting their video games not to lag on their computers. A world in which open source technology, 3d printing, the blockchain, etc. provide a universal high standard of living all across the world.

It's not too late not to lose hope. ;-)

topic.title: Storing user-uploaded Big Files on different Directories/Hard drives
topic.body:
Something I'm thinking about. I've been getting addicted to seeding and torrenting big files lately, however, unlike traditional torrenting, I kinda have to settle with having all my files in the data/user/xxx folders of ZeroNet. I'm also eventually gonna run out of space, lol.. but I want to buy a new hard drive.

Would be great if we had options on where to store these files.

You can submit bugs in the Issues tab in GitHub.

bump!

Gonna be uploading Rick and Morty season 3 on a daily basis, alongside the newest South Park TV shows, Game of Thrones.. as well as the newest BRrip releases of the latest 2017-2016 films, going back in time until every movie is added.

I'll be releasing a movie encoding tutorial pretty soon, using Handbrake. Encoding is an artform in and of itself.. i can't stand watching encodes that have uneven FPS or are blurry or have the wrong aspect ratio or shitty sound etc. That's why RealKittyKate only uploads quality encodes, and would encourage future torrenters to do the same.

**Please let me know what other shows you want added to the list! Encoding videos for online streaming is easier said than done, but step by step we can do this!**

bump! new movies added..

Make sure you hit our new feed button next to the search bar at Kopykate so that you can get the latest movie uploads!
bump! two new shows fully uploaded: Rick and Morty, Stranger Things.

> [blazar](#comment_4_1P1baCe1LLjror4CZjChWFy7D7cVWyPL83): I see a lot of left-right-racial bullshit in comments. First of all: these terms like "left" and "right" are tools developed for manipulation.  Both "left" and "right" movements exist for one purpose: to don't let people move with own way. Left? Right? Just fuck off! There is only self-defense for any human with brain who understand current situation - not left or right sides. The "racist" term is just another tool. As it mentioned in topic message "anti-racist" means anti-white. This is just the fact which can be seen by anyone in racial subjects, in so called "white guilt" phenomena especially.  [...]

Except, whatever biological differences there may exist between races .. should not be used to justify discriminatory policies.

Live and let live.

Anti-racism doesn't necessarily mean anti-white. Yes, a lot of self-proclaimed 'anti-racists' (e.g. Black Lives Matter, antifa) are guilty of hypocrisy and racism themselves.

However, racism is still a problem around the world .. and there's nothing wrong with exposing a racist whenever it is appropriate, as everyone has the right to equal opportunity.

11_1H5UJ7LneToGqYqJ9fbLnu1Ko2pxTpchof.body:
huh?

Well, Facebook has been around since 2004. Whatsapp.. never really use it, I just use Facebook Messenger Lite to talk to friends and family.

People don't usually feel the need to change what they are used to, unless the alternatives offer something different.. such as digital freedom, privacy, etc.

21_1H5UJ7LneToGqYqJ9fbLnu1Ko2pxTpchof.body:
I for one would welcome a ZeroNet dating site. Normies scare the hell out of me.. at least here you get people with interesting stuff to talk about.. like science, politics, space, programming, networking, etc.

I've always wanted to see a dating site that uses actual scientific algorithms in order to match people up, as opposed to pseudo-scientific junk like your Horoscope, or simply matching up interests and hobbies.. which doesn't always translate to successful matches.

e.g. According to a study I've read a few years ago, you're more likely to be attracted to people who share similar facial features with you. This phenomenon has even been observed in people's choices of pet animals.. you're more likely to pick a dog or a cat that 'kinda looks like the owner'.

In other words, we are genetically pre-programmed to seek the Familiar.

28_1H5UJ7LneToGqYqJ9fbLnu1Ko2pxTpchof.body:
Yeah, I'd say it's simply not a good idea to have unsecured networks.

Every wifi extender should have a web interface (usually something like 192.168.20.1.. or 192.168.10.1) where you can set up WPA2 passwords. You just plug your laptop directly into the device via Ethernet and then type the Gateway ip into your browser.. whichever IP is listed in the manual. You can buy wifi extenders for like $15 on eBay or aliexpress, and they sometimes even work better than the pricier ones you get at electronics shops.

If you wanna share it, I'd recommend only sharing it with people you trust. Have a chat with neighbours and all that. Plan ahead.

Public wifi hotspots are different. Obviously, they have better internet speeds and security systems in place to prevent hacking, etc. They also employ more pricey antennae and boosters to provide better coverage.. a Wifi extender won't cut it.

Never buy phone data. It's on the same level as selling your camera at a Pawnshop because you're broke, or buying bottled water - you'll ALWAYS get a bad deal. It's a waste of money. Obviously if you're rich, it's a different story.. but then rich people can afford better plans where you can buy tons of data in bulk, saving you money in the long run.

It's much better just to wait till you get home so you can use the internet, or just look for public wifi hotspots in town. I myself don't have any problem with waiting till I get home.. also my college has free WiFi. I haven't had to buy phone credit for months.. except for that time when I needed Google maps cause I was going on long trips around town. I don't even top up my phone, I just talk to people via Messenger.

Back when I was really broke and living in a trailer, I used to use a long-range 24dbi parabolic grid antenna in order to connect to wifi hotspots that were 300m away. Limited data on mobile broadband was killing me, so I said fuck it.. lol

1_1BM5RxgUfzF8tXYBMbsh7mTjA8JRWEW72c.body:
I honestly don't see much point in such independence movements. It's one thing if you're trying to escape a tyrannical government, and trying to create a better and happier society by declaring independence.. but this is just born out of petty cultural / historical grievances, it seems.

Fighting tyranny is all cool, but you need to be careful that you don't end up becoming a tyrant yourself. What are you going to do after independence? If you can't answer that question, don't declare independence.

test:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/big.kopykate.bit/?Video=1508239539_1

Ok. Now I'm drunk.
BUG FIXED: Accidentally got the wrong number of max megabytes allowed for optional big files, which prevented bigger uploads than 20-50mb for me and other users. Fixed now!

> [krixano](#comment_98_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): There seems to be a small bug with the zite. When you click on "My Channel", it underlines "Airing Now" instead, but it does show the correct videos in the videos list.

Yep.. I noticed that. It's supposed to show you the latest videos that you've uploaded to your channel.. so it's kinda accurate.. but yeah, I'll be sure to fix that soon!
Yes, but one can simply disable downloading and sharing big files on the proxy.

> [hippoki123](#comment_2_1GhYpibzrzQ9FZTeoeHxG297hgcqcv71X2): btw, Will this webzite support subtitle/embed features? I'm waiting for it

At the moment, it'll be up to the uploader to encode subtitles into their videos, and it's really easy to do with HandBrake. There should be a plethora of tutorials available on YouTube for the uninitiated.

but yes, based on my findings.. it should be simple to add an HTML5 <track> element to the video player so as to allow users to write vtt files and publish the subtitles to the blockchain. I don't think SRT files work with HTML5.. but apparently there are some SRT > VTT converters.

I'm not sure how embedding might work, probably only on ZeroNet.. but yeah I guess I'll experiment with that too.

My priority right now is also to integrate a javascript FFMPEG encoder that can be used directly on the site, so that you can encode your videos properly before they are uploaded.. so as to avoid the dreaded 'MIME TYPE OR FILE FORMAT NOT SUPPORTED' that many newcomers are producing.

> [krixano](#comment_102_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): btw, if you accept KaffieId, I think you should use auth_address instead of cert_user_id for the routing because multiple people can have the same cert_user_id for KaffieId.

Never thought of that. Thanks for letting me know.. easy fix anyway. ;)

> [akito](#comment_248_1F8omDpXyPsBfd9CBJ91o4Wv1AA2KxqMEY): So maybe we should legalize eating dogs and cats, too. That has about the same priority.

What I do in my spare time without interfering with the rights of animals, or humans, is nobody's business.

> [akito](#comment_250_1F8omDpXyPsBfd9CBJ91o4Wv1AA2KxqMEY): My right as a human is not to be gased by smoke at the bus station. So actually smoking should be forbidden in total.

Smoking is already forbidden in public places.

I should add, legalizing cannabis would bring far more jobs than any old commie or corporate neo liberal could ever conjure up from out of thin air.

We want free markets and new industries - not communism or crony capitalism.!

> [akito](#comment_251_1F8omDpXyPsBfd9CBJ91o4Wv1AA2KxqMEY): My point is, I don't wanna spend my time, or even worse, see actual politicians waste their time on the most unimportant topics of all, like legalizing cannabis or gay marriage, or whatever that bullshit is. Yes, I don't mind if someone does it for themselves, but that's so unimportant, we all can live without legalizing this or criminalizing the opposite.Basically every time I see politicians talk about legalizing cannabis for example (mostly greens), then I already can't take them serious for wasting their right to speak publicly in a certain time frame with shit like that. What do I care if cannabis is legal or not. It doesn't matter, at all.

You're just validating my point - it doesn't matter if people smoke weed or not.
The fact of the matter is, our jails are being clogged with people who could be working and paying tax as we speak..so it's really nothing to do with weed per se, but about respect for individual Liberty.

> [akito](#comment_253_1F8omDpXyPsBfd9CBJ91o4Wv1AA2KxqMEY): To me, that's bullshit talk from weed people. If they wanna smoke, then let them smoke. I don't see any point in legalizing it. Actually I see a point in forbidding every way of smoking, ever. Smoking is cancer. Literally. Literally literally.

So you're basically saying.. let them smoke, but don't legalize it?

In other words, keep the law as it is, but don't enforce it?
Also think about how many dairy robberies and murders will go unsolved for every cop who wastes time trying to look for a plant.

> [akito](#comment_254_1F8omDpXyPsBfd9CBJ91o4Wv1AA2KxqMEY): No, not at all. If someone would smoke and I would never ever even notice the slightest bit of it, I don't care. But basically you notice it on every smoker and most of them give you literal cancer. In my opinion, that should be charged as physical assault, or worse.

So it should be illegal to smell bad?

> [akito](#comment_255_1F8omDpXyPsBfd9CBJ91o4Wv1AA2KxqMEY): You are missing the point more and more. I wasted already 5 minutes of my life in this conversation talking about shit like this. I think nobody in political charge should ever even talk one word about cannabis or anything like that, because that's literally a big waste of breath. What do I care if druggie weeders go to jail for their "plants"? That's not unjust to do. Every smoker should be cured in a psychiatric hospital anyway, for being depressive enough to not be able being happy in life without smoking.

You don't have to have the conversation.

Considering how strongly you feel about cannabis users, it really does seem like an important issue to you after all. 

Would you say the same thing about people who drink alcohol, drink coffee, play violent video games, watch porn? Surely, they need to be sent to re-education camps so they can be happy listening to Christian country music instead. What a lovely government it would be to live under!

2_17H8EGEoNF1z2AXFtXmBQJLHTmh7gMGzzS.body:
Another thing I noticed is that voters aren't necessarily to blame for bad governments, either. Most people just live in fear and prefer the stability and normality of that which they're already used to.. coming home, watching sports on TV while drinking beer and ordering takeaways, etc.

Real change takes danger, risk.. suffering, pain. Most people want bread and circuses.

An anarchist thus isn't going against the will of the people or the will of democracy. 

Deep inside, people do want change, they do want to live happier lives.. they do want more than the 9-5 rat race that is stealing our souls and causing depression, anxiety, eating disorders, obesity.. etc... but they're afraid of taking a risk or trying something new. 

They want a guarantee that things will work out.. that's why they'd prefer to vote for a Bible-thumping douchebag in a suit and a tie, than someone who might bring new ideas to the table. The former comes with a guarantee, you know what you get - you get what you're already used to; coming home after work and tuning into the latest cricket match while you munch on your Pizza Hutt order.. then drink yourself to sleep only to wake up again and go back to work.

The latter comes with risk and uncertainty. You may end up with a far better society, but you may also get riots, protests .. economic recessions.. etc.

An anarchist essentially gives up on politics and creates their own micro-utopia within their own communities, so that people can try out new societies without destroying existing ones.

7_17AMQVbBa12XB3xFWKDnP2dCEx92TaiY7X.body:
> [styromaniac](#comment_144_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): The zite owner was seeding by keeping WebTorrent Desktop open or keeping tabs open, then gave up instead of working on a solution like installing Vuze with WebTorrent plugin. I wish they'd switch to large file support or put the site on GitHub. It looks nice even if it's not functioning. It's not fundamentally flawed. It's just that the owner didn't work on a better solution for seeding.

Vuze is pretty bad at seeding WebTorrent files. It craps out after a while.. stops communicating altogether.. then you need to restart the program and wait 5 minutes or so. WebRTC communication also has the side-effect of consuming a ton of CPU, which increases exponentially the more files you add..

WebTorrent has largely been abandoned. The project creator also stopped replying to GitHub issues.

4_1HtGfHk2MuqcB5nYXZ6b2NajXJLoxfq7XS.body:
I haven't seen many proxies around lately. 

We really need proxies with lots of storage nowadays. Fuckcf.cf is the only zeronet proxy that I know of that isn't dead, but even they can't handle big files. KopyKate big for example stopped working on that proxy after they deleted all the files.. instead of simply disabling seeding.

Once I become more financially stable I'll set up a decent New Zealand-based zeronet proxy with one of my college friends. I have one running on my PC right now, but I use it mainly for friends.. it reveals my IP because it's hosted on my computer, that's the only thing that stops me from going fully public with it.

3_15de5wZ71q8iQGhEmBkJnRKx37Defn5XoL.body: ZeroNet as a whole is practically an anarchist forum. lol

4_15Q5U52Aqgjb66GkzhkGKDYgWsqR8TEkJG.body: The reason we're here in the first place is because translation AI software still sux.

6_1LWErNVFAu2wJT2XBoVkLDCmY41EX32knU.body: How can we trust your group to be legitimate? I've seen your Reddit posts but there's a lot of deleted comments.

5_17H8EGEoNF1z2AXFtXmBQJLHTmh7gMGzzS.body:
> [naeui7tycw9p35y9](#comment_15_1CaVUegZMXMjmRXtq5q3eZDqdtsoNvgep): did you try a https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Symbolic_link?

I've just looked that up, actually. I just feel it would be too much of a pain doing all that command line, especially when ZeroNet gets really, really big.

well.. considering how the client is running on your computer, I would assume it should be able to access files outside of zeronet masterseed folder.. i.e. ../../../My_Custom_Big_Files_Folder/xxxxx/data/users/xxxxxxxxxxxxx/this.mp4

> [krixano](#comment_105_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): Currently, zites can simply link to the file based on a relative link going into the user's folder. But if we move the files, it will no longer work, which means we need to ask ZeroNet for the directory path of the file, which would mean yet another command.

Couldn't this be relative to each individual user's client, though?

> [krixano](#comment_106_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): Okay, so for example, I have an optional file stored in my user's directory. The zite can access it by going to data/users/[my auth address]/file.ext. When someone download's the optional file, the zite will just use this url because it's relative to the zite and it's always located in the same place. But if we start moving files around, we instead have to ask the ZeroNet client where the file was moved to because everyone could move it to different places.

I suppose there should be a way to set up some automatic symbolic linking system.

I'm also a big confused as to how the Optional big file settings work.. seeding part of the file.

At the moment, every time I watch a big file video.. it forces me to download it all to the hard drive. In the case of videos, there should be a way to simply stream them.

10_1F8omDpXyPsBfd9CBJ91o4Wv1AA2KxqMEY.body: People's desire for comfort and safety is what is at the root of tyranny. It usually takes deaths, widespread police brutality and riots to really get people worried. I'd go as far as to say even that is not enough.. you need total societal collapse to get people to turn off the football games and start caring.

1509129499_17H8EGEoNF1z2AXFtXmBQJLHTmh7g.body:
Of course, the problem with mass-disliking is that a lot of them create fake accounts in order to achieve this. And true, not everybody has the disk space required in order to be a dedicated seeder. . .

I never thought of that last idea.. sounds like a good idea; only show the like/dislike ratio after the vote has been casted. That gets rid of herd mentality.

Luckily, the ZeroNet community hasn't had too many problems as of late, in terms of trolling. We seem to be pretty civil, even with all the alt-right-type threads popping up like 'Kill All Muslims' and stuff.. lol

1509159570_17H8EGEoNF1z2AXFtXmBQJLHTmh7g.body:
Now that I think about it, creators and artists probably do have at least one realiable line of defense - that sweet honeymoon period where your work is still sitting in your hard drive, and hasn't yet been published to the world. It's only after a digital copy is released that you can't take it back.

For example, I couldn't pirate Stephen King's IT right now if I wanted to, because the DVD / Bluray version hasn't been released yet. That means I can only choose to go to the cinema (which I did.. it was great!) or I can put up with watching one of those below-standard, shitty TeleSync  copies off of The Pirate Bay.. where you can hear people coughing and sneezing .. or even potentially put up with fake torrents that contain viruses and malware (not much of a problem for me because I use Linux.. never had a virus on it .. ;p)

Downloading torrents also takes time.. and a lot of pirates suck at encoding.. so in effect, customers are less likely to bother getting a free copy of something if they can get what they want faster, and with better quality. Don't think of users who pirate as 'lost revenue'.. think of it as free marketing.

..>.>...Now that I think about it, I should probably submit this as my essay-writing assignment, where we had to choose any random topic and then write about it in-depth.. so long as it is in some way related to IT. 
..
Bingo. Homework done!

That's the problem - it's all just limited to million-dollar projects that they can show off on TV, or luxuries for the rich.

1509293876_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body:
You can easily delete files on the ZeroHello page, on the left menu. There's Sites, and then there's Files. Click on Files and delete any big file you want from any site. I'll start work again on KopyKate soon, once I finish a YouTube video I'm working on.. 

Also, I wouldn't recommend using a phone for the purpose of seeding large amounts of video files. That doesn't quite make sense. . it would be like using a teacup to do your laundry.

15517_1KbV1e1u6P6AsY8XNBydgtbtN8iSB5WMyG.body: That's the problem with dark web drug dealers. You have decentralized marketplaces, but you don't have decentralized package delivery. > [phr34kzz](#comment_2_166Kgk6LesoTpoTTWciSHeq98UB4mTUcsf): ZeroNet isn't meant for bigfiles. It's built to host small static sites. See there's a thin line between using and understanding. Go read up the Git and Wikis again. IPFS works similarly like Zeronet and yes it's P2P but meant for storage. Unlike Zeronet, there's never a short of peers connected to speed up download of your files. No one said that there's inability of bridging. And lol! So it happens you are Kitty. 1509315919_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body: So long as you can define an Algorithm for how such a technology could work, the code is not going to be a problem.

1509342996_1CT7RxDQNPEE8X78bDkUPhuaaUUix.body: You can remove your private keys from the Users.json file. It's only there by default for newbies who just wanna clone sites and experiment.. but if you're hosting a serious site, get rid of the "Privatekey" entry in Users.json, after you've copied it to a USB stick or something, or written it down. Then make your site public.

1509348404_166Kgk6LesoTpoTTWciSHeq98UB4m.body:
> [phr34kzz](#comment_10_166Kgk6LesoTpoTTWciSHeq98UB4mTUcsf): Well that's Zeronet for you LOL! One has to view or enough peers to even view/download the sites content. IPFS has no problems with that :P All you noobs do is complain

What have you got stored in there, anyway.. a mountain of cocaine?

1509479387_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body: I shut down Apache and switched on Nginx and it's now pointing at https://www.bigcat.tk/
As with Kittyseedbox redirecting to sketchy places, I think my free domain subscription ran out. lol

> [styromaniac](#comment_170_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): Don't get free or dirt cheap domain names ever again. I'm not the only one who knows this. Lots of webmasters have made that mistake and warm others about it.
 
I'm gonna be switching to ClouDNS.net soon.
bigcat.tk was registered with freenom, but the domain name servers are at cloudns.net

> [krixano](#comment_126_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): Actually, I'm getting something too, but not quite as severe. When I first visit the zite (www.bigcat.tk - which then opens zerohello) and click anywhere, a new tab opens for a second then closes. Then I am able to click stuff again. This is the type of thing done by popups, but my browser is smart enough to close it because it knows it's not good. Another way you can tell is if clickable items don't have the pointer cursor until after you click once and that new tab opens. [...]

That was me. I just signed up to AdMaven to monetize the proxy.

I'm monetizing the proxy through AdMaven (not KopyKate big, just the proxy.. so if you view without the proxy, there's obviously not gonna be any ads).

> [krixano](#comment_143_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): So your monetizing service brings up ads that auto download stuff that looks like Flash Player, but really isn't? Sorry, I won't be using bigcat.tk anymore.

I'm actually keeping an eye on the links that pop up, but I haven't encountered the fake Flash Player yet. Are you able to show me a screenshot? I'll be trying out many networks but if one ad network does that to you, then I'll switch to another one.
